title.narrative: MONITORING AND DATA FOR CHILDREN

description.narrative: By 2021, WCAR COs and RO have enhanced capacities to generate, analyse, manage and use priority quality evidence (SITAN, studies, research, evaluations, MICS) for improved child rights monitoring, equity-focus and evidence-based programmes with emphasis on programming and fragile countries.,which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Evaluation And Research. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: RO and COs implement adequate cross sectoral strategies to improve programming excellence and achieve quality and equitable results for children.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2021, WCAR COs and RO have enhanced capacities to generate, analyse, manage and use priority quality evidence (SITAN, studies, research, evaluations, MICS) for improved child rights monitoring, equity-focus and evidence-based programmes with emphasis on programming and fragile countries.

description.narrative: In 2019, over half of the 24 countries in West and Central Africa have generated new data and evidence which contributes to SDG monitoring as well as evidence-based decision-making at policy and program level in support to the progressive realization of WCA region children's rights. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Number of RMT sessions at which progress against KRC targets is examined
# CO that have conducted a MICS6 secondary analysis
% of SITANs under development on which RO provides feedback for improvement of quality
% of countries engaged in MICS6 and having released the Survey Findings Reports (SFR) within a year
CO rating of RO performance in provision of technical assistance in Programme Planning and Monitoring (out of/5)
# of COs supported to develop KM strategy/plan based on UNICEF Global strategy 2020
% of ROMT meetings at which ROMT receives an update on Scorecard status

Number of COs that update status of all KRC indicators in RAM as part of (a) 2018 annual reporting, and (b) 2019 mid-reporting. Exception allowed for (i) indicators not applicable to the country and (ii) indicators for which there is not updated status to report.

target.value: 2019:(a) 2018 annual reporting: 24 COs, (b) 2019 mid-year reporting: 24 COs

title.narrative: Results achieved by the Think Tanks and working groups are assessed at the end of the year.
% of COs using Global established LTA on quality of studies and reviews included in EISI
